title: A Cooperative Multi-Agent Framework for Zero-Shot Named Entity Recognition
author: Zihan Wang (University of Amsterdam), Zhumin Chen (Shandong University), Ziqi Zhao (Shandong University), Maarten de Rijke (University of Amsterdam), Yougang Lyu (University of Amsterdam), Zhaochun Ren (Leiden University), ...
relevance_why: The framework's focus on multi-agent systems and self-annotating mechanisms for entity recognition could inspire novel approaches in audio analysis or other generative tasks, especially in creating intelligent systems that leverage language models.
background: Zero-shot Named Entity Recognition (NER): identifying named entities in text without annotated training data, challenging due to data sparsity.
contribution: This paper introduces a Cooperative Multi-Agent Framework (CMAS) to address challenges in zero-shot NER, achieving significant performance improvements in benchmark tests.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods either neglected contextual correlations between entities or relied heavily on poorly curated demonstrations, causing performance degradation.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating multiple agents that collaboratively extract type-related features and evaluate the helpfulness of demonstrations, enhancing prediction robustness.

key_innovation: Employs a multi-agent architecture where agents specialize in self-annotation, feature extraction, demonstration evaluation, and prediction to enhance NER tasks.
real_world_impact: The framework significantly enhances entity recognition performance with no need for annotated data, which could impact applications in information extraction, search engines, and automated content generation.

new_terms.Cooperative Multi-Agent Framework: **Cooperative Multi-Agent Framework** refers to a system that utilizes multiple specialized agents working together to solve complex problems collaboratively.
new_terms.type-related features: **Type-related features** are contextual tokens associated with specific named entity types that enhance contextual understanding during the NER process.

open_sourcing: Our code is available at https://github.com/WZH-NLP/WWW25-CMAS
